just-cartesian-product.description: Takes an input of an array of arrays and returns their Cartesian product.

just-compact.description: Returns a copy of an array with falsey values removed
examples: compact([1, null, 2, undefined, null, NaN, 3, 4, false, 5]); // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

just-group-by.description: Return a grouped object from array

just-index.description: Return an object from an array, keyed by the value at the given id

just-insert.description: Inserts a sub-array into an array starting at the given index. Returns a copy

just-intersect.description: Return the intersect of two arrays

just-last.description: Return the last member of an array

just-mean.description: The mean (average) value in an array

just-median.description: Return the median value of an array of numbers

just-mode.description: Return the most frequently occuring number(s)

just-partition.description: Elements satisfying predicate added to first array, remainder added to second

just-percentile.description: Return the value at the given percentile (using linear interpolation)

just-permutations.description: Returns all permutations of the length N of the elements of the given Array

just-random.description: Return a randomly selected element in an array

just-range.description: Generate a range array for numbers

just-shuffle.description: Return the elements of an array in random order
examples: // array with original elements randomly sorted
// array with original elements randomly sorted and all in new postions

just-skewness.description: Return the skewness of an array or numeric argument list using Pearson's second skewness coefficient

just-sort-by.description: Produces a new array, sorted in ascending order

just-split.description: Splits array into groups of n items each

just-split-at.description: Splits an array into two at a given position

just-standard-deviation.description: Return the standard deviation of an array or numeric argument list

just-tail.description: Return all but the first element of an array

just-union.description: Returns the union of two arrays

examples: unique([a, a, b, c, b]); // [a, b, c]

just-variance.description: Return the standard deviation of an array or numeric argument list

just-zip-it.description: Returns an array of grouped elements, taking n-th element from every given array

just-clone.description: Deep copies objects, arrays, maps and sets
examples: // Deep copies objects and arrays, doesn't clone functions
var obj = { a: 3, b: 5, c: arr, d: subObj };
// arrays: if length, sequence and values of properties are identical
// objects: if length, names and values of properties are identical

description: Return an object representing the difference between two other objects
Pass converter to format as http://jsonpatch.com
examples: // using converter to generate jsPatch standard paths

just-diff-apply.description: Apply a diff object to an object. Pass converter to apply a http://jsonpatch.com standard patch
examples: // using converter to apply jsPatch standard paths
// arrays (array key can be string or numeric)

just-flush.description: Returns a copy of an array or object with null/undefined members removed
examples: flush([true, null, false, true, [null], undefined]); // [true, false, true, [null]]
flush({a: 2, b: null, c: 4, d: undefined}); // {a: 2, c: 4}

just-pluck-it.description: Pluck a property from each member of a collection

just-compose.description: Return a function composed of 2 or more functions

just-demethodize.description: Turn a method into a standalone function; the first arg becomes `this`

just-flip.description: Flip first two arguments of a function

just-memoize.description: An implementation of the memoize technique
examples: sumByOne(10); // Returns value returned by the function
sumByOne(20); // Returns value returned by the function
// Custom cache key (key defaults to JSON stringified arguments)
sum(10, 10); // Returns value returned by the function
sum(10, 20); // Returns value returned by the function

just-memoize-last.description: A memoize implementation that only caches the most recent evaluation

just-once.description: Create a function that can only be invoked once

examples: // no matter how many times the function is called, only invoke once within the given interval
const fn3 = throttle(() => console.log('hello'), 500, {leading: true, trailing: true});
const fn4 = throttle(() => console.log('hello'), 500, { leading: false });

just-clamp.description: Restrict a number within a range

just-in-range.description: Check if number is within a given range

just-modulo.description: Modulo of a number and a divisor

just-random-integer.description: Produces a random integer within a given range
examples: // Returns a random integer between 0 and 5 (inclusively)
// Returns a random integer between 3 and 10 (inclusively)
// Returns a random integer between -5 and 10 (inclusively)

just-entries.description: Return object entries as an array of [key, value] pairs

examples: // returns a new object containing those original properties for which the predicate returns truthy
filter({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (key, value) => value < 6); // {a: 3, b: 5}
filter({a: 3, b: 5, c: null}, (key, value) => value); // {a: 3, b: 5}

just-has.description: Return a boolen indicating the existence of a deep property, don't throw if parent is undefined

description: Return true if object has a circular reference
NOTE: not supported in IE or microsoft edge

just-is-empty.description: Return true if object has no enumerable key values

just-is-primitive.description: Determine if a value is a primitive value

just-map-object.description: Map an object, passing key and value to predicates
examples: map({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (key, value) => key); // {a: 'a', b: 'b', c: 'c'}
map({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (key, value) => key + value); // {a: 'a3', b: 'b5', c: 'c9'}```

just-map-keys.description: Map an object, predicate updates keys, receives (value, key, object)
examples: // predicate updates keys, receives (value, key, object)
map({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (value, key) => key + value); // {a3: 3, b5: 5, c9: 9}
map({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (value, key, obj) => obj.b + value + key);

just-map-values.description: Map an object, predicate updates values, receives (value, key, object)
examples: // predicate updates values, receives (value, key, obj)
map({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (value, key) => value + key); // {a: 3a, b: 5b, c: 9c}
map({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (value, key, obj) => obj.b); // {a: 5, b: 5, c: 5}

just-merge.description: Shallow assign. Like just-extend but without deep copy option.

just-omit.description: Copy an object but omit the specified keys

just-pick.description: Copy an object but with only the specified keys

examples: // applies a function against an accumulator and each key-value pairs of the object
// to reduce it to a single value
reduce({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (acc, key, value, index, keys) => {
reduce({a: 3, b: 5, c: 9}, (acc, key, value, index, keys) => {

just-safe-get.description: Get value at property, don't throw if parent is undefined

just-safe-set.description: Set value at property, create intermediate properties if necessary

just-values.description: Return property values as an array

just-camel-case.description: Convert a string to camel case
examples: // all caps substrings >= 4 chars are camel-cased

just-capitalize.description: Capitalize the first character of a string

just-kebab-case.description: Convert a string to kebab case

just-left-pad.description: Add characters to the left of a string such that its total length is n

just-pascal-case.description: Convert a string to pascal case

just-prune.description: Prune a string with whole words and a custom suffix
examples: prune('when shall we three meet again', 7); // 'when...'
prune('when shall we three meet again', 7, ' (more)'; // 'when (more)'

just-replace-all.description: Replace all occurrences of a string within a string with another string

just-right-pad.description: Add characters to the right of a string such that its total length is n

just-snake-case.description: Convert a string to snake case

just-squash.description: Remove all spaces from a string, optionally remove escape sequences too
examples: squash('the cat sat on the mat'); // 'thecatsatonthemat'
squash(' the cat sat on the mat '); // 'thecatsatonthemat'
sat on the mat`, true); // thecatsatonthemat
template('2 {{a.aa.aaa}}s, a {{a.aa.bbb}}, 3 {{a.bb}}s and a {{b}}. Yes 1 {{a.aa.bbb}}.', data);
// '2 apples, a pear, 3 oranges and a plum. Yes 1 pear.'

just-truncate.description: Truncate a string with a custom suffix
examples: truncate('when shall we three meet again', 9); // 'when s...'
truncate('when shall we three meet again', 10, ' (etc)'); // 'when (etc)'
truncate('when shall we', 10, ' (etc etc etc)'); // ' (etc etc etc)'

just-deep-map-values.description: Returns an object with values at all depths mapped according to the provided function
examples: deepMapValues({ a: 1, b: { c: 2, d: { e: 3 } } }, squareFn); // => { a: 1, b: { c: 4, d: { e: 9 } } }

just-pipe.description: Pass a value through a pipeline of functions
examples: pipe('John Smith', a => a.split(' '), b => b.reverse(), c => c[0]) // 'Smith'
